body:
### Problem

neovim crash

### Steps to reproduce
init.lua
```lua
vim.o.statuscolumn = "%s%l"
vim.o.signcolumn = "yes"
vim.o.number = true

local ns = vim.api.nvim_create_namespace("visual_range")
vim.api.nvim_buf_set_extmark(0, ns, 1, 0, {
    end_row = 4,
    strict = false,
    sign_text = "W",
})

vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd("ModeChanged", {
    pattern = "n:V",
    callback = function()
        local s, e = vim.fn.line("."), vim.fn.line("v")
        vim.api.nvim_buf_set_extmark(0, ns, s - 1, 0, {
            end_row = e - 1,
            strict = false,
            priority = 1,
            sign_text = "W",
        })
    end,
})

vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd("ModeChanged", {
    pattern = "[vV\x16]:*",
    callback = function()
        vim.api.nvim_buf_clear_namespace(0, ns, 0, -1)
    end,
})

vim.keymap.set("o", "k", ":<C-u>norm! Vj<CR>", { silent = true })
```
test.lua:
```lua
first
second
third
four
```
1. nvim test.lua (use the above snippets)
2. type `gck`
3. neovim crash

### Expected behavior

don't crash

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.11.0-dev-1961+g7e2b75760f Build type: RelWithDebInfo LuaJIT 2.1.1741571767 Run "nvim -V1 -v" for more info

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

no

### Operating system/version

macos 14

### Terminal name/version

kitty

### $TERM environment variable

xterm

### Installation

build from source

title: Crash when setting statuscolumn
